METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Jugoslovani iz zadrege ali iz prepričanja in veselja? Razumevanje patriotizma in odnos do kraljeve dinastije Karađorđević pri Slovenski ljudski in Narodni radikalni stranki v letih 1918-1941
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Yugoslavs out of Embarrassment Or out of Earnest Belief and Delight? The Concept of Patriotism and the Position of the Slovene People’s Party and of the National Radical Party on the Royal Karadjordjević Dynasty between 1918 and 1941
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Ratej, Mateja
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: Avtorica se v prispevku ukvarja z vprašanjem patriotizma in odnosom do kraljeve dinastije Karađorđević pri SLS in NRS v letih 1918-1941. Patriotizem je bil najvidnejši in najbolj neposreden način politizacije jugoslovanske ideje pri obeh strankah ter je bil najizraziteje vezan na kraljevo dinastijo. V političnem diskurzu je bil kralj Aleksander Karađorđević najpomembnejši faktor generiranja in obstanka jugoslovanske ideje. SLS je v njegovi osebi na skupni imenovalec speljala politizacijo navidez nezdružljivih paradigem (jugoslovanskega) patriotizma, (slovenske) nacionalne zavesti in avtonomistične ideje, hkrati pa je SLS kraljevo vlogo interpretirala kot najpomembnejši agens za prehod od »velesrbske« mentalitete k jugoslovanski.

The paper focuses on the perception of the royal Karadjordjević dynasty by thè Slovene People’s Party (Slovenska ljudska stranka) and by the National Radicai Party (Narodna radikalna stranka) during the 1918-1941 period. In order to politicize the issue of Yugoslavia both parties utilized the concept of patriotism by focusing particularly on the royal dynasty, with King Aleksandar Karadjordjević portrayed as the principal agent and advocator of the Yugoslav issue. Using his royal status for its own agenda, the Slovene People’s Party combined and promoted three seemingly incompatible concepts, namely those of (Yugoslav) patriotism, (Slovene) national consciousness, and the idea of autonomy; at the same time, the king’s role had been interpreted as the most crucial factor in the transition from the »grandiose« Serbian mentality to Yugoslav mentality.
